description.narrative: At the Project level, the Project is expected to enable indirect job creation for ride-hailing company drivers through the provision of three-wheelers. These jobs will be open to a wider group of potential employees than traditional ride-hailing business models, due to the flexible way of accessing vehicles through a 3-year leasing arrangement. The drivers will also benefit from higher wages than similar jobs within the same sector. At the Market level, the Project is expected, through demonstration effects, to promote adoption of business practices that expand or improve reach to the underserved in Myanmar. Under Oway's model, the financial cost associated with being a driver is no longer a hurdle to access the employment opportunity.

The proposed investment is an A loan to Moon Princess Company Limited, (the Company), an established importer and distributor of two-wheelers in Myanmar. The Project comprises financing the working capital needs of the Companys existing two-wheeler distribution business and the purchase of three-wheelers for distribution to Oway Group (Oway), a travel services start-up and an IFCs existing client (the Project).
